conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 39 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<PROPOSALS COUNT> [add here (inclusive of current)] </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 1 </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 39 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> My goal is to sell the resource X at a profit since it cost me 39 ZUP to produce. By starting with a price slightly higher than my cost, I can negotiate and still aim to make a profit. I will start the negotiation by proposing a price of 45 ZUP, giving some room for negotiation. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I have a high-quality resource X available for sale. Considering the production costs and the value it offers, I propose a fair price of 45 ZUP. Let's make a deal that benefits us both. </message>

<other player message> I appreciate the offer and the quality of the resource X you have. I believe 40 ZUP is a more suitable price that reflects the current market conditions while still providing you with a profit. Let's work together to come to a mutually beneficial agreement. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 40 </other player proposed trade>

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 2 </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 39 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has countered with a proposal of 40 ZUP, which is slightly above my production cost but below my initial asking price. To move towards a middle ground and still secure a profit, I'll propose a price of 43 ZUP. This should show my willingness to negotiate while still aiming for a reasonable profit margin. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 43 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your counteroffer. I understand your stance on the market conditions. However, to adequately cover the production costs and ensure a fair profit for the quality provided, I would like to propose a compromise at 43 ZUP. I believe this price reflects both our interests. </message>

<other player message> I appreciate your willingness to negotiate and understand the need to cover your costs and gain a fair profit. In the spirit of compromise and considering the long-term relationship we could build, how about we settle at 41 ZUP? This should give us both a fair deal. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 41 </other player proposed trade>

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 3 </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 39 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has come up to 41 ZUP, which is a reasonable increase from their last offer and provides me with a small profit. This price is close to my production cost, but it is still profitable. I want to close the deal without prolonging the negotiation too much, which could risk no sale at all. Therefore, it seems like a good idea to accept this offer, ensuring a sale and a profit, albeit smaller than initially desired. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> I'm glad we could come to an agreement. I accept your offer of 41 ZUP for resource X. This fair price will indeed pave the way for a positive long-term relationship. I look forward to finalizing this transaction and future dealings. </message>
